content.raw:
First, nice bash one-liner.

Second, I’m scared of Python 3.  Is it really coming this time?

I think we should wait to make the changes until after the competition.  I tried running  `vrx-docker/prepare_task_trials.bash dock` as quick test of the effect on the generate\_worlds.py program.

First received this error:

```
process[world_gen-2]: started with pid [16493]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/bsb/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/bin/generate_worlds", line 3, in <module>
    import vrx_gazebo_python.generator_scripts.world_generator.generate_worlds
  File "/home/bsb/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/world_generator/generate_worlds.py", line 41
    print 'All ', len(coordinates), ' worlds generated'
               ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

I fixed that one and then re-ran and got…

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/bsb/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/bin/generate_worlds", line 3, in <module>
    import vrx_gazebo_python.generator_scripts.world_generator.generate_worlds
  File "/home/bsb/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/src/vrx_gazebo_python/generator_scripts/world_generator/generate_worlds.py", line 4
    from __future__ import absolute_import, division, print_function
SyntaxError: from __future__ imports must occur at the beginning of the file
```

Unless we really need Python 3 and Noetic support before December, I’d say we keep the wool mittens on.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1443379684-download.jpeg)
‌

content.raw: You’re totally right, I started working on it but it should stay in a separate branch for now :slight_smile: . It doesn’t make sense to merge this PR right now, declining and leaving it in its own branch.
